Exposes.name: linkquality
Exposes.label: Linkquality
Exposes.description: Link quality (signal strength)

Exposes.name: battery
Exposes.label: Battery
Exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported

Exposes.name: keypad_lockout
Exposes.label: Keypad lockout
Exposes.description: Enables/disables physical input on the device

Exposes.name: programming_operation_mode
Exposes.label: Programming operation mode
Exposes.description: Controls how programming affects the thermostat. Possible values: setpoint (only use specified setpoint), schedule (follow programmed setpoint schedule), schedule_with_preheat (follow programmed setpoint schedule with pre-heating). Changing this value does not clear programmed schedules.

Exposes.name: mounted_mode_active
Exposes.label: Mounted mode active
Exposes.description: Is the unit in mounting mode. This is set to `false` for mounted (already on the radiator) or `true` for not mounted (after factory reset)

Exposes.name: mounted_mode_control
Exposes.label: Mounted mode control
Exposes.description: Set the unit mounting mode. `false` Go to Mounted Mode or `true` Go to Mounting Mode

Exposes.name: thermostat_vertical_orientation
Exposes.label: Thermostat vertical orientation
Exposes.description: Thermostat Orientation. This is important for the PID in how it assesses temperature. `false` Horizontal or `true` Vertical

Exposes.name: viewing_direction
Exposes.label: Viewing direction
Exposes.description: Viewing/display direction, `false` normal or `true` upside-down

Exposes.name: heat_available
Exposes.label: Heat available
Exposes.description: Not clear how this affects operation. However, it would appear that the device does not execute any motor functions if this is set to false. This may be a means to conserve battery during periods that the heating system is not energized (e.g. during summer). `false` No Heat Available or `true` Heat Available

Exposes.name: heat_required
Exposes.label: Heat required
Exposes.description: Whether or not the unit needs warm water. `false` No Heat Request or `true` Heat Request

Exposes.name: setpoint_change_source
Exposes.label: Setpoint change source
Exposes.description: Values observed are `0` (manual), `1` (schedule) or `2` (externally)

features.name: local_temperature
features.label: Local temperature
features.description: Current temperature measured on the device

features.name: pi_heating_demand
features.label: PI heating demand
features.description: Position of the valve (= demanded heat) where 0% is fully closed and 100% is fully open

Exposes.name: occupied_heating_setpoint_scheduled
Exposes.label: Occupied heating setpoint scheduled
Exposes.description: Scheduled change of the setpoint. Alternative method for changing the setpoint. In the opposite to occupied_heating_setpoint it does not trigger an aggressive response from the actuator. (more suitable for scheduled changes)

Exposes.name: external_measured_room_sensor
Exposes.label: External measured room sensor
Exposes.description: The temperature sensor of the TRV is â€” due to its design â€” relatively close to the heat source (i.e. the hot water in the radiator). Thus there are situations where the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV is not accurate enough: If the radiator is covered behind curtains or furniture, if the room is rather big, or if the radiator itself is big and the flow temperature is high, then the temperature in the room may easily diverge from the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV by 5Â°C to 8Â°C. In this case you might choose to use an external room sensor and send the measured value of the external room sensor to the `External_measured_room_sensor` property. The way the TRV operates on the `External_measured_room_sensor` depends on the setting of the `Radiator_covered` property: If `Radiator_covered` is `false` (Auto Offset Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 3 hours. After 3 hours the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 30 minutes or every 0.1Â°C change in measured room temperature. If `Radiator_covered` is `true` (Room Sensor Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 30 minutes. After 35 minutes the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 5 minutes or every 0.1Â°C change in measured room temperature. The unit of this value is 0.01 `Â°C` (so e.g. 21Â°C would be represented as 2100).

Exposes.name: radiator_covered
Exposes.label: Radiator covered
Exposes.description: Controls whether the TRV should solely rely on an external room sensor or operate in offset mode. `false` = Auto Offset Mode (use this e.g. for exposed radiators) or `true` = Room Sensor Mode (use this e.g. for covered radiators). Please note that this flag only controls how the TRV operates on the value of `External_measured_room_sensor`; only setting this flag without setting the `External_measured_room_sensor` has no (noticeable?) effect.

Exposes.name: window_open_feature
Exposes.label: Window open feature
Exposes.description: Whether or not the window open feature is enabled

Exposes.name: window_open_internal
Exposes.label: Window open internal
Exposes.description: 0=Quarantine, 1=Windows are closed, 2=Hold - Windows are maybe about to open, 3=Open window detected, 4=In window open state from external but detected closed locally

Exposes.name: window_open_external
Exposes.label: Window open external
Exposes.description: Set if the window is open or close. This setting will trigger a change in the internal window and heating demand. `false` (windows are closed) or `true` (windows are open)

Exposes.name: day_of_week
Exposes.label: Day of week
Exposes.description: Exercise day of week: 0=Sun...6=Sat, 7=undefined

Exposes.name: trigger_time
Exposes.label: Trigger time
Exposes.description: Exercise trigger time. Minutes since midnight (65535=undefined). Range 0 to 1439

Exposes.name: algorithm_scale_factor
Exposes.label: Algorithm scale factor
Exposes.description: Scale factor of setpoint filter timeconstant ("aggressiveness" of control algorithm) 1= Quick ...  5=Moderate ... 10=Slow

Exposes.name: load_balancing_enable
Exposes.label: Load balancing enable
Exposes.description: Whether or not the thermostat acts as standalone thermostat or shares load with other thermostats in the room. The gateway must update load_room_mean if enabled.

Exposes.name: load_room_mean
Exposes.label: Load room mean
Exposes.description: Mean radiator load for room calculated by gateway for load balancing purposes (-8000=undefined)

Exposes.name: load_estimate
Exposes.label: Load estimate
Exposes.description: Load estimate on this radiator

Exposes.name: preheat_status
Exposes.label: Preheat status
Exposes.description: Specific for pre-heat running in Zigbee Weekly Schedule mode

Exposes.name: adaptation_run_status
Exposes.label: Adaptation run status
Exposes.description: Status of adaptation run: None (before first run), In Progress, Valve Characteristic Found, Valve Characteristic Lost

Exposes.name: adaptation_run_settings
Exposes.label: Adaptation run settings
Exposes.description: Automatic adaptation run enabled (the one during the night)

Exposes.name: adaptation_run_control
Exposes.label: Adaptation run control
Exposes.description: Adaptation run control: Initiate Adaptation Run or Cancel Adaptation Run

Exposes.name: regulation_setpoint_offset
Exposes.label: Regulation setpoint offset
Exposes.description: Regulation SetPoint Offset in range -2.5Â°C to 2.5Â°C in steps of 0.1Â°C. Value 2.5Â°C = 25.
